The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future! Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

Position description
The position involves working to identify, evaluate, and protect new technologies and innovations coming from Mayo's research and clinical activities with a focus on artificial intelligence/machine learning, and digitally enabled solutions. Specifically, the incumbent will identify and foster the continuing development and disclosure of new digital technologies and intellectual property to Mayo Clinic Ventures and be accountable for functions such as: a) assisting in identifying potentially patentable inventions or proprietary algorithms and approaches; b) providing background materials, such as prior art searches and market landscape assessments; c) working with clinical and research staff to develop plans to further advance promising new technologies and assisting in identifying funding sources; d) assisting in developing technology summaries and other marketing materials




Bachelor’s degree in Biological or Physical Sciences or Business is required. Three years’ experience in an academic research environment or healthcare industry is required.




A Master's degree or PhD in these same fields of study is preferred. Must have the ability to recognize new technology opportunities and unmet clinical needs and act as an interface to facilitate the protection and advancement of technologies to improve patient care. Must possess excellent interpersonal skills, be detail oriented, be able to manage a large number of ongoing projects simultaneously and effectively communicate as a liaison among inventors and Mayo Clinic Ventures .


Exempt


Education, experience and tenure may be considered along with internal equity when job offers are extended. The minimum salary every 2 weeks is approx $2,832.80, based on a full-time position.

Actively help support internal and external work on annotating machine learning data. Actively participate in the CNHi AI/ML development community sharing your knowledge and experience and bring AI/ML knowledge from other CNH Industrial teams into the Autonomous Technologies group. Work as part of a larger development team developing technologies for autonomous off-road equipment.

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

Description
At BASF , we create chemistry through the power of connected minds. By balancing economic success with environmental protection and social responsibility, we are building a more sustainable future through chemistry. As the world’s leading chemical company, we help our customers in nearly every industry meet the current and future needs of society through science and innovation. We achieve this through our commitment to continuous improvement and operational excellence, which gives us the opportunity to set and deliver on ambitious, long-term goals. We provide a challenging and rewarding work environment with a strong emphasis on process safety, as well as the safety of our employees and the communities we operate in and are always working to form the best team—especially from within, through an emphasis on lifelong learning and development. This allows for our employees to innovate and generate new ideas, put them into action, and gain insights from them to further advance our collective expertise. And we are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America’s Best Large Employers in 2021. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future! Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

Work as part of a larger development team developing technologies for autonomous off-road equipment.

Passionate about tackling and solving challenging problems

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

This allows for our employees to innovate and generate new ideas, put them into action, and gain insights from them to further advance our collective expertise. And we are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America’s Best Large Employers in 2021. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future! Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

Position description
The position involves working to identify, evaluate, and protect new technologies and innovations coming from Mayo's research and clinical activities with a focus on artificial intelligence/machine learning, and digitally enabled solutions. Specifically, the incumbent will identify and foster the continuing development and disclosure of new digital technologies and intellectual property to Mayo Clinic Ventures and be accountable for functions such as: a) assisting in identifying potentially patentable inventions or proprietary algorithms and approaches; b) providing background materials, such as prior art searches and market landscape assessments; c) working with clinical and research staff to develop plans to further advance promising new technologies and assisting in identifying funding sources; d) assisting in developing technology summaries and other marketing materials




Bachelor’s degree in Biological or Physical Sciences or Business is required. Three years’ experience in an academic research environment or healthcare industry is required.




A Master's degree or PhD in these same fields of study is preferred. Must have the ability to recognize new technology opportunities and unmet clinical needs and act as an interface to facilitate the protection and advancement of technologies to improve patient care. Must possess excellent interpersonal skills, be detail oriented, be able to manage a large number of ongoing projects simultaneously and effectively communicate as a liaison among inventors and Mayo Clinic Ventures .

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

This allows for our employees to innovate and generate new ideas, put them into action, and gain insights from them to further advance our collective expertise. And we are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America’s Best Large Employers in 2021. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future! Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

Core Responsibilities
Guides the successful completion of programs that identify patterns and make decisions with minimal human intervention. Determines the technical objectives of an assignment. The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

This allows for our employees to innovate and generate new ideas, put them into action, and gain insights from them to further advance our collective expertise. And we are constantly striving to become an even better place to work. BASF has been recognized by Forbes Magazine as one of America’s Best Large Employers in 2021. Come join us on our journey to create solutions for a sustainable future! Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

CNH Industrial is a global leader in industrial goods. We are looking for a highly skilled and energetic person to play a key role in improving and
supporting our perception systems for highly automated and autonomous agriculture & construction equipment. You will be joining a research and engineering team to provide critical skills and thinking in improving existing systems and developing new concepts pushing technology forward within the organization. This Machine Learning Data Engineer will take responsibility for tasks covering the front portions of the machine learning workflow including: data collection, data ingestion, data pre-processing and validity checking, data storage & access, and data annotation methodologies & techniques. They will be part of a cross-functional team involved in the design and development of tools, processes and infrastructure supporting this. Actively help support internal and external work on annotating machine learning data. Work as part of a larger development team developing technologies for autonomous off-road equipment.

2+ years working in support of machine learning in developing machine learning systems, with extensive experience on deep learning systems
Experience working to setup and utilize corporate cloud computing services (e.g. Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.)
Experience working with Big Data tools and programing database (e.g. SQL, Apache, etc.) systems
Experience working with High-Performance Computing (HPC) systems and enterprise network design
A working knowledge of vehicle network communication protocols (CAN, LIN, ISOBUS, BroadR-Reach, etc.)
Experience working with agriculture and/or construction equipment in the field
Competent in programming languages, for example C/C++,Python, SQL, Java, R, etc.
Attention to detail and ability to work independently
Excellent communication and team work skills
Passionate about tackling and solving challenging problems
Familiar with the basic methods and practices for data annotation from state-of-the-art sensor technologies
Experience working in the agricultural and/or construction industry

As a ML scientist, you will apply your ML skills to a wide variety of problems and datasets, primarily focused on remote sensing (acoustic, RF, and other) applications. Current projects include auto-detection and classification of acoustic targets. You will bring experience, entrepreneurship, and creativity to our programs. You will interact with customers, lead technical project teams, and spearhead growth in new areas. We are looking for someone to join our team onsite, although we offer flexibility to work from home part-time or have flexible in-office hours.

About us
Nearly Human AI is a cutting edge technology company that specializes in cloud based machine learning and AI automation. We are currently in product development of a conversational virtual employee that will revolutionize how our clients approach their business models in clean energy, social services, law enforcement and national defense.
Seeking a motivated, skilled data scientist to join a fast-paced team set to disrupt the AI market. Nearly Human is a startup brand that recently secured funding to launch a revolutionary virtual employee system. We will move the industry from annoying bots that are merely glorified FAQ sheets, to Nearly Human virtual employees that can automatically detect issues and opportunities as they arise. We provide intelligent, conversational help with complex problems and seamlessly assist human agents.
Our proprietary technology will streamline implementation and maintenance of automated systems drastically reducing onboarding and maintenance time when compared to the typical rules based systems that dominate the customer support space today.

Sense’s mission is to reduce global carbon emissions by making homes smart and efficient. We make it easier for people to take care of their homes and to actively participate in a cleaner, more resilient future. We’re serious about having a real impact on climate change.
To accomplish this mission, we are building an AI and automation platform for home energy infrastructure. Come join the Data Science team and ship a great consumer product built on our unique machine learning technology. If the idea of having a significant positive impact on the product sounds exciting to you, let's talk!

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect the nation. Our mission requires a strong offense and steadfast defense. The offense collects and processes foreign signals, and disseminates vital information for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents and eradicates cyber threats to U.S. national security systems and critical infrastructure. The tremendous complexity of NSA's mission requires world-class researchers, scientists, programmers and engineers who work in artificial intelligence, high performance computing, hardware and software reverse engineering, information technology infrastructure, data science, software engineering, architectures, computer security and networking, among others. NSA researchers invent and design new approaches to computing technology and find innovative uses for existing technology, ultimately providing technical capabilities necessary to execute the Agency's critical mission. Description of Position NSA Researcher Scientists are actively expanding the boundaries of what can be accomplished with artificial intelligence, machine learning, human-machine teaming, software reverse engineering, and high performance computing. Our experts generalize mission problems, advance the scientific state-of-the-art to solve the problem, and work with other NSA organizations to get solutions in front of mission users and decision-makers. NSA research activities have saved lives, and they continue to make the U.S. and its allies safer and more secure. In addition to working closely with mission partners, our researchers also collaborate regularly with the scientific community, academia, industry, and other government laboratories; publish papers on unclassified aspects of our work in scientific journals and at conferences; transfer NSA technology to the marketplace through open source software releases and public-private partnerships; serve as faculty members at local universities; and participate in university and K-12 STEM outreach activities across the country. Unlike other research facilities, NSA laboratories are funded internally, which allows our researchers to spend their time conducting research rather than writing proposals. Specifically NSA is interested in applicants conducting research in artificial intelligence and machine learning, data science, human-machine teaming, novel architectures, cybersecurity, software reverse engineering, computer vision, and computational linguistics. Successful candidates should have demonstrated success in conducting Computer Science research and a proven track record of turning research ideas into running prototype-grade systems. As a Research Scientist, other responsibilities may include: - Conducting scientific experiments, documenting results, and communicating with colleagues, customers, and decision makers - Training, testing, and deploying machine learning models - Applying software engineering principles to design and/or develop software applications - Designing and optimizing algorithms, data structures, modeling, and analytics to solve real-world scientific problems - Using principles, techniques, procedures, and tools to architect and facilitate the development of hardware solutions - Developing methods and applications for tools to exploit and analyze computer systems and network vulnerabilities

Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.

Quantum Computing Scientist – Machine Learning – Iselin, NJ Where the Chemistry Happens We are seeking a professional like you to serve as Quantum Computing Scientist in Iselin, NJ.
Qualifications - BASF recognizes institutions of Higher Education which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or equivalent
Formula for Success Successfully engaging within and outside the organization, you will establish and coordinate collaborations with industrial and academic partners in the field of Next Generation Computing, specifically in the area of quantum computing. Contributing strong domain expertise in machine learning, optimization, statistics, mathematics, or quantum computing, you will make internal and external multi-disciplinary collaborations a success. Leveraging your PhD education and training in Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Chemistry, Engineering or a related discipline and your machine learning, statistics, deep learning or optimization, you will be responsible for the preparation and pre-processing of relevant use cases, as well as post-processing of quantum computing results using state-of-the-art classical computing approaches and emerging quantum technologies (e.g. NISQ and beyond). Your strong programming and algorithm development skills in modern languages such as Python will be essential as you (co-)develop and apply quantum computing methods, algorithms, and workflows to solve relevant use cases. Demonstrating your technical skills, you will be responsible for the comparison of different quantum computing and state-of-the-art classical computing approaches to assess feasibility and determine the best approaches to realize business-value driven use cases. Your experience in quantum computing (particularly in related software libraries and toolkits such as Qiskit, Cirq, Pyquil, Pennylane), as well as software libraries related to annealing or quantum inspired will enable you to make software solutions for relevant use cases available to the broader machine learning, optimization and next generation computing communities at BASF. Your fluency in spoken and written English (fluency in German or additional languages a plus) will serve you well as you document and disseminate project results in the form of talks, reports, and publications. Being motivated to work in an interdisciplinary, cross-functional environment, as well as willingness to constantly learn in a quickly evolving and challenging field, you will build up further competencies by following the latest developments in the quickly evolving field of quantum computing. Working as a creative, highly motivated, communicative and open-minded team player, you will propose new ideas on exploring further use cases in the broader context of Next Generation Computing, including but not limited to leveraging public funding opportunities. Create Your Own Chemistry: What We Offer You Adding value to our customers begins with adding value to you. You@BASF is the suite of benefits, perks, programs and unique opportunities we offer to support you—the whole you—in all stages of your life and career. With you@BASF, you create your own chemistry. The total rewards that you receive as a BASF employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career. BASF provides interesting and challenging learning and development opportunities to help you make the most of your talents and your job.
